HTML & CSS 1 - Lesson 1

Home Part 1 Part 2 Part 3 Part 4
Part 1

Discussion

Kickoff

What do we need to get started writing HTML & CSS. Wait, what are HTML & CSS even?

Understanding HTML

Common HTML Terms are the base for writing any website. We will start to understand what it takes to write an html node through elements, tags and attributes.

Creating your first HTML document

HTML documents are plain text documents with a .html extension. You will learn how to build your first webpage!

Practice

Tip Top Cafe's Website

Create a new HTML page for a new restaurant! We need to make sure it has the store name, a paragraph describing the food, and some contact information.

Discussion

Understanding CSS

We are going to learn what it takes to give a website it's look and feel. CSS at it's simplest form is comprised of selectors, attributes and values.

Working with Selectors

Selectors will give you the ability to find HTML nodes. Once you are able to learn how to select the elements you can properly assign styles.

Referencing CSS

In order to get our CSS talking to our HTML, we need to reference our CSS file within our HTML. This can help us stay more organized the further we get into a project.

Using CSS Resets

You may have noticed that some elements have default styles we haven't declared within our CSS. Let's learn how to reset the default styles.

Practice

Tip Top Cafe's Website

Add a CSS reset to your project to give yourself a better starting spot.

Discussion

Getting to Know HTML

In order to start building websites, we need to learn a little about which HTML elements are best used to display different types of content.

Semantics Overview

Semantics is the practice of giving content on the page meaning and structure by using the proper element. Semantic code describes the value of content on a page.

Identifying Divisions & Spans

Divisions are HTML elements that act as containers solely for styling purposes. We will learn how to use this to setup the structure of a website.

Text-Based Elements

By using semantic based markup, we can give our text more meaning and power with search engines.

Building Structure

For the longest time the structure of a web page was built using divs or tables. Let's learn a more semantic way to give our website structure.

Practice

Tip Top Cafe's Website

Let's add semantic content to our restaurant project you are working on.

Discussion

Creating Hyperlinks

Hyperlinks provide you the ability to link from one web page to another.

Practice

Tip Top Cafe's Website

Let's add new links to a few new pages for our restaurant project we are working on.
